This game is all around amazing. Controls are not bad once you modify them to your standards. Or, do what I did and use your Bluetooth Controller. Def. worth the money. Fun. Funny. Violent and one hell of a time killer. Also has high replay value. 10/10 - One of, if not my favorite mobile game.
Just finished it awesome game!
The best game i played one of the best rpg games
Great game. I own this game on xbox1, pc and Nintendo. I hope they bring shakedown Hawaii to Android too. I definitely will buy it.

Pixel theft auto: Chinatown wars is a remake of waveracer64. Probably the second best money I've ever spent*. An increadable, atmospheric and packed open-world just waiting to be explored. The top down style pays homage to its predesors for example: stealey Wheely automobeely. Thats it. I especially like the art style; bright, colorful and unique. If you want a good game, I don't know how you're here, but buy it. Truly a masterpiece of a game. *The best money Ive ever spent was Gromit Mug

Reminds me of GTA 1 and 2, it's a fun little game well worth the money, the touchscreen controls can be a little hard to get used to but it never took away from the overall experience, if you like old video game's 80's/90's this is the game for you, from funny references to weapons straight out of a NES game (my fav is thd lightgun) This game offers a freeroam mode for those times when you want to just kick back and mess around with some cheat codes. A must have app to kill some time 8/10.
Good

Good game and also own this on Steam too. Only problem I've had was getting my Xbox controller to work correctly. The game acts like I'm continually pressing up on the right stick. At first I thought it was a problem with the joypad having drift and needing an adjustable dead zone to fix. After some experimenting I found that even with the joypad unplugged after the problem started it would still continue as if I was pressed up on the stick still. I've tested for pad drift too with none found.
Whoever designed the last stage can go to hell

Not really a fan of retro games or 8 bit they seem blatant to me but this game caught my naked eyes this game is absolutely incredible the atmosphere is so good and the missions are amazing especially the final one even if you complete the story dont stop playing the game has alot to offer a ton of challenges in the challenge mode free roaming mode gives you full freedom of the world and the side missions I will complete this game 100% if you like gta series you will LOVE this game.
...excellent game. Just wish there was an option to remap controls/buttons.

An older game that has been upgraded well over the years and still holds up today. This is the fill package and offers a ton of content with loads of references and nods throughout gaming history. The price is well worth it and I easily would of paid more and not batted an eye.

A game that will mostly take most of your time. The Story is hilarious, the gameplay is very nostalgic, yet feels very fresh. Overall the game is amazing.

So much fun. I would recommend anyone that likes reto games and the original 2D GTA style type of game. I love how this game pays home age to a number of classic games from back in the day. There is a lot of enjoyment to be had here.
Fun game

Pop Theft Culture: Vice City Take the pre-3 GTA top down formula, throw in more 1980's references to feel/video game culture than "Ready Player One", add some nostalgiatastic 8/16 bit pixel graphics and chiptunes, and bake until playable in DOS on an actual 3.5" floppy disc, and you'll have some idea what this game is.
I like the references to other videogames, the time-period and the retro graphics style. You have tons of options to customize the looks and it is fun.

Pleasantly surprised to see VBlank is still supporting this version of the game four years later! The DX+ update adds animated cutscenes and character portraits, eschewing the static assets of old. If I were to make one little change, it would be to allow Players to toggle between the classic and revised cutscenes/portraits as they see fit, for those inevitable purists out there.
Awesome, the graphics are awesome. I would love to have a mobile version of Shakedown Hawaii as well.

replyContent: UPDATE: Please try update 1.0.4 and let me know if it resolves your issues. It should run at a solid 60 fps. Thanks!

content: I love this game!!!
replyContent: We've tracked it down to a qualcomm driver bug with glTexSubImage2D. A fixed driver exists, but many phones haven't yet received it, thus your "newest" driver is still actually an older one. We're trying to figure out a workaround in the meantime. UPDATE: version 1.0.5 should resolve this issue.

Played on a Galaxy Note 5 running 6.0.1 using a Moga Pro controller. Has 90,000 possible Google Play Achievement XP points. Has a lot of tweaks for screen appearance. Game looks and plays great on my setup with zero stuttering or lag. An excellent value for what you get! The 90,000 XP points and gamepad support is what caught my eye first, then the look & solid game play hooked me. Vblank set the bar high for their first Android offering & the Dev did a great job bringing this to Android👍😉👉💯
Very funny and open world

No longer will we have to rely on PPSSPP and DOSBox to play the game on phones (I also own the Wii version). I also really dig the fact that there's a "right stick" for more precise aiming. Is there a possibility that you could also implement a style of aiming similar to the Steam version's mouse aiming using touchscreen? Ideally, the left stick would always have to be (at least faintly) visible and set in a configurable position to do this. No crashes and erratica on Nexus 6, talented and supportive development team.
The game is awesome! Pixelated chaos.
replyContent: Please update to version 1.0.5. It fixes your issue, which was caused by a Qualcomm driver bug.

replyContent: EDIT: We purchased a Moto Z Play *just* to fix your issue! We've verified it's a driver bug, and previously explained that in detail. UPDATE: version 1.0.5 resolves the slowdown on the Moto Z Play. Should be available in the next hour.

content: Works almost perfect on the Pixel XL

I bought this game after loving it on the 3ds. I bought it on the motto z play, and while it is a good game on the 3ds, it is unplayable on my phone (due to frame rate problems) but from the comments it seems like there is only a frame rate problem on the motto z play. I kept the game to support the company because it is an amazing game from what I played. I'm just curious if you guys planning on fixing this problem, and when you think that might happen. Thanks to the developers for fixing the problem.
replyContent: Hi there, sorry for your troubles. Update 1.0.5 has been released which resolves the slowdown on Moto Z Play. It should be available in the next hour.

content: Still unplayable on MZP. Uninstalled and reinstalled, phone on latest update, no issue with other games from other developers. Have to wonder what they're doing if they can't get an 8bit game like this working on a well known handset after multiple attempts. Very disappointing. EDIT: I'll bump this up to three stars based on their comms and the fact they finally found a fix. Still took them ages to resolve it though.
replyContent: EDIT: Sorry it took so long to resolve, but the Moto Z Play was out of stock at stores everywhere here, we had to order it online and wait for delivery. We reached out to Qualcomm regarding the driver bug, but due to the holiday and CES, it took longer than normal for them to provide a workaround. We've done everything as quickly as possible.

replyContent: Thanks Reginald! Update 1.0.5 resolved the slowdown on Moto Z Play.

content: This is a great game, and support got back to me pretty quickly when I was having some Bluetooth controller issues. They were prompt and courteous, and I am having a lot of fun playing through everything the game has to offer. Thanks! I have an older Moga Pro Power, and if you do too you need to change its input method to Mode B so it is registered as a HID. Once done, everything works fine and you can enjoy the game.
replyContent: We'll look into supporting it in a future update, but it's actually not a standard Android controller, but rather a proprietary one requiring custom support.

content: RCR: DX is a great game and it fits perfectly on phone with the arcade challenges and chaos. This was one of my favorite games on 3DS and I'm glad I can play it on phone now. Keep up the good work and I'll be happy to see a sequel or new content.

I already own this game on PC but purchased this App. to send a message to App. Developers, “I WANT to pay for good games!” I’m so tired of free games that are fun but where you have to buy $10-$50 worth of “Stars” or “Power ups” just to gain a level or something. If you build a good game people like me will happily pay a premium for it. This App. Was worth every penny and I would have gladly paid more!

This has to be one of them best top down pixel RPG'S! It's funny, has lots of missions and side missions, love the weapon options...the game is great! The driving controls aren't the best though and the achievements don't always work. Otherwise great game for one man!!!
Truly an amazing game! Keep up the good work.
Loved it on psp!!so yeah already a fan

content: This game is great, I originally bought it in my 3DS but now I have it on my 3DS, Phone and PC so there really isn't an excuse for me not to play it. If you are reading this Vblank, please release shakedown hawaii on mobile when it releases.

Since I've unlocked Meat Boy the game takes around 30-40 seconds to start. Loved this game on PC. Loved it even more on mobile. Especially with a controller. Keep it up.
replyContent: Thanks! A slow start would be caused by the game connecting to Google Play services for Achievements, Cloud Save, etc. and having issues with (or a slow) internet connection -- you could probably disable that if you don't use those features and want it to start more quickly.

content: The game always force closes on me when i either click on the map or pause the game then click on map.Please fix this, my device is a Samsung Galaxy Tab A.Also can you increase the button size,increase the graphics to 16-bit and make a multiplayer/online free roam mode that does not use google play games multiplayer.Thank you and Happy holidays!
replyContent: We'll figure out what's happening with the pause/map and fix it soon. Glad you like the game and thanks for letting us know!

content: Game is epic and very smooth on my note 4 feels good to have retro gaming I can take with me

The game is fun, and it's story mode kept me entertained for a few hours, but there are a few annoying things. 1. The manual driving controls need a horizontal joystick, it would make driving SO much easier. (yes, I am aware of the automatic controls and I do use them, but manual works so well on consoles) 2. Why does the stomp button only appear when flying? It should appear during jumps as well. 3. The map should have a joystick option. Sorry for sounding nitpicky, but I just wanted to get these opinions out there. Happy Holidays.
replyContent: Glad you like it and I appreciate the feedback. The attack button does a stomp when you're in the air, but a separate one was added when flying so you can multi-touch more easily. I tried changing the attack icon to stomp when you're jumping but it was too distracting.

replyContent: Thank you so much! Very kind of you to support the game like this. Happy Holidays!

It finally works again thank you and the game speed works fine everything is great and working thanks for fixing the problem 👌
The best game ever

It runs slow on the Moto Z Play though, and I wish it worked with the MOGA Pocket. EDIT: Just updated to 1.0.4, and unfortunately it's still slow. It works fine on my Shield Tablet, so it'd seem like it would do the same on here.
replyContent: UPDATE: We've tracked it down to a qualcomm driver bug with glTexSubImage2D. A fixed driver exists, but Motorola hasn't yet integrated it, so your "newest" driver is still actually an older one. We're trying to figure out a workaround in the meantime. UPDATE 2: Version 1.0.5 just released which fixes the slowdown on Z Play. Available in the hour.

content: I have it on all the avalable platforms and I must say it is amazing. Thanks for sure a good quality and fun game. I look forward to other releases from your company.
I don't know what's up with all the whiners on here but I find this game to work very well and I have a Samsung Galaxy S7. Works smoothly with no issues. And I like the nostalgia of the game as well.
Great game. Awesome design. It could be perfected though with additional clothing and etc. Other than that this game is well worth the money.
replyContent: Thanks! It does contain over 200 styles (hair/hats/faces/glasses). They can be found through various shops in the city (find them on the map screen).

content: 1.0.4 fixed the issues with my phone. I love this game :) it's what all retro style games should strive for.
replyContent: We're investigating the bug and aim to have a fix for your phone soon. Thanks for your patience. EDIT - can you try version 1.0.4 and let us know if it resolves the issue?

content: Ever since the slow bug has been fixed I've been enjoying the game on my device. Thank you. Worth the cash.
replyContent: Update 1.0.3 should fix your issue. Please try it out and let us know. Thanks! EDIT - can you try version 1.0.4 and let us know if it resolves the issue?

content: Just like the one I bought on ps3. Very fun game. Way better than the overpriced Mario run crap.

I uninstalled and reinstalled it with the patched version which seemed to help fix it. It still slows a bit if too much is happening on screen, but is much more playable now. Thanks a lot for the super quick response time from the developers with this! Great work guys!
replyContent: Excellent to hear! The upcoming 1.0.4 should eliminate your remaining slowdown completely, stay tuned :)

content: 8bitdo Controller bugging
replyContent: What issue are you having specifically? Please email support with more details and we'll work to fix it.

content: Own this game on other consoles and I can never get enough of its soundtrack or gameplay
Plays smooth on nexus 6. I might need a gamepad to enjoy full blast L(・o・)」

The new patch fixes the earlier slow game issue on my s7.  For those experiencing the same issue,  you have to uninstall and reinstall the game,  not just update it. Devs acted within hours with a fix.  Thank you,  much appreciated!
replyContent: Hi Marco, sorry for your troubles. Version 1.0.3 has been pushed out which we hope addresses this issue.

content: Fast paced, smooth sailing without hitch, solid gameplay. Love this game.

Hey guys I so sorry but I downloaded the game in ignorance. I thought I could play it on my phone. But guess not. 😌😌 I gave it five stars because it looks cool and I so wanted to play it. So I was hoping you could reimburse me. I buy things on here regularly so I'm sure I will put it towards another game lol😝😝. Thanks in advance
replyContent: The Z828 seems like it should be compatible without issue. Can you email support with details and to request a refund?

content: Another awesome indie port for my Shield Tablet. A wonderful surprise on the google Play Store. Much love! Thank you!! Worth the re-purchase! Loved both versions on all my PS consoles and even the New 3DS port. Loving it all over again.

Cars just take off like a bat outta hell almost completely uncontrollable.  Such a shame this game is not designed for touch controls this is a game that clearly requires a Bluetooth controller to play.
replyContent: UPDATE: Have you tried "Manual" driving controls as opposed to the "Automatic" which you're using? 55% of players prefer manual. Please let us know. Email support if you need more in-depth resolution.

content: This game is a gem and plays great on mobile. It's the perfect game for $5 on my phone and the file size isn't too big either. On a side note, I got to meet Brian (the developer of this game) at the PlayStation Experience a couple of weeks ago and just from my short time talking with him it was made clear how passionate he is about making this game the best it can be on as many platforms as he can get it on. And after trying this mobile version out it really shows.
A great port of RCR DX to Android! I have the desktop version, and being able to play it on the go makes me happier!
Never heard about this game before, but I'm glad I got it. The pop culture references are a great touch.
Playable, witty and charming, RCR is like a gaming history best-of. The touchscreen controls work surprisingly well for a game as complex as this, though of course not comparable to a proper gamepad
Retro City Rampage is what all indie games should aspire to be like. Best game ever, and perfect for phones. It's about time the Android version came out!
First played this game one my 3DS a few years back. And loved it. Great to see it on Android, with new improvements.
